Issues.Title: [release/3.0] Update dependencies from dotnet/core-setup
Issues.Body:
This pull request updates the following dependencies

## From https://github.com/dotnet/core-setup
- **Build**: 20190409.10
- **Date Produced**: 4/10/2019 1:17 AM
- **Commit**: 9771101e02bd2e84305f58b83bb3364fb8eaf318
- **Branch**: refs/heads/release/3.0
- **Updates**:
  - **Microsoft.NETCore.App** -> 3.0.0-preview4-27609-10

## Coherency Updates

The following updates ensure that dependencies with a *CoherentParentDependency*
attribute were produced in a build used as input to the parent dependency's build.
See [Dependency Description Format](https://github.com/dotnet/arcade/blob/master/Documentation/DependencyDescriptionFormat.md#dependency-description-overview)

- **Microsoft.NET.Sdk.IL** -> 3.0.0-preview4-27608-74 (parent: Microsoft.NETCore.App)
- **Microsoft.NETCore.ILAsm** -> 3.0.0-preview4-27608-74 (parent: Microsoft.NETCore.App)

## From https://github.com/dotnet/core-setup

- **Commit**: 89ba5a781188bb95f7de3c2714fdddd19f341f32
- **Branch**: refs/heads/release/3.0
- **Updates**:
  - **Microsoft.NETCore.App** -> 3.0.0-preview4-27609-12

- **Microsoft.NETCore.ILAsm** -> 3.0.0-preview4-27608-74 (parent: Microsoft.NETCore.App)

Issues.Title: Add ToolboxItem tests and fix bugs
Issues.Body:
Fixes #704 
Fixes #705
Fixes #706
Fixes #723
Fixes #724 
Fixes #725
Fixes #727

Issues.Title: ToolboxItem.ToString returns `null` if DisplayName is null
Issues.Body: Should return `string.Empty` to match coding guidelines

Issues.Title: ToolboxItem.FilterPropertyValue("AssemblyName", new object()) throws InvalidCastException
Issues.Body: Should return the value

Issues.Title: ToolboxItem.GetHashCode throws NRE if DisplayName is null
Issues.Body: Should use `0`

Issues.Title: Create tests for ported components for DevExpress
Issues.Body:
We have ported several components from framework to core. These components were lack of unit tests and during the porting process we agreed to create only minimal unit tests to keep the process faster and unblock the customers porting process as soon as possible.

These components need more through unit tests to be added.

Related issue: #221 

Portability report available: https://microsoft-my.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/personal/dreddy_microsoft_com/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc={1b3ac7ac-3792-4bcc-8d58-8185fa1d1557}&action=edit&activeCell=%27Details%27!B76&wdInitialSession=b95b5c5e-57b6-47cc-88ff-5ca14cbb4182&wdRldC=1
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Create tests for ported components for DevExpress" (#716)

The `Form1.resx` file and `xlf` folder are copied from C# template.

Issues.Title: Accessibility: fixing DataGridView BoundingRectangle property for row, data cells and header cells
Issues.Body: The change is related to the issue #710.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Accessibility: fixing DataGridView BoundingRectangle property for row, data cells and header cells" (#711)

Issues.Title: Accessibility: Invalid BoundingRectangle value for DataGridView cells and headers
Issues.Body:
Bounding rectangle of the header and data cells are not being contained within the parent element (row) and the top element (DataGridView). If a magnifier is trying to magnify this element, it will magnify parts of the element that arenâ€™t visible.
This only happens when cells don't fully fit on the screen and scroll bar appears.

**Expected result:**
Bounding rectangle for all cells should be within parent element.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Accessibility: Invalid BoundingRectangle value for DataGridView cells and headers" (#710)

Issues.Title: ToolboxItem.Properties for "DependentAssemblies" does not validate the value type like for the other properties
Issues.Body: Allows values, e.g. new object(), causing `InvalidCastException`s when used. Should just return throw `ArgumentException` when set like everything else

Issues.Title: Fix coverlet report generation
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fix coverlet report generation" (#702)

Issues.Title: WinForms ComboBox SelectedIndexChanged event behaves inconsistently
Issues.Body:
If the SelectedIndex property is set programatically, the event does not fire unless {new value <> old value}. However, if the user accesses the drop-down and selects an item (via the GUI), the event always fires (even in the case where the new value is the same as the old value).

Looking at the reference source, this can be traced to the fact that WmReflectCommand always calls OnSelectedIndexChanged() when processing CBN_SELCHANGE, but the SelectedIndex property setter compares old and new values before doing anything.

It's not 100% clear that this is a bug (there is some sense in working the way it does), but it is definitely misleading and should be documented if this behavior is by design.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WinForms ComboBox SelectedIndexChanged event behaves inconsistently" (#730)
